title: Peloton Tested a U.S. Safety Watchdog. It Wasn't the First.
summary: A public clash between the at-home fitness giant and a U.S. regulator showed how messy consumer product recalls can be. Peloton Interactive Inc. fought to become a breakout star in the at-home fitness industry. It didn't back down when the Consumer Product Safety Commission first warned the public to stop using Peloton's treadmills.

title: Japan Closes Its Olympics With Baseball Gold After Win Over U.S.
summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-The idea of the U.S. ever being a baseball underdog is about as far-fetched as an American mistaking baseball for cricket.

title: What Is a 'Drawdown'?
summary: In the simplest terms, it's a loss, and knowing an asset's drawdown history can help investors build a portfolio. Sometimes stock-market research reports refer to something known as "drawdowns." But it's not always clear what the term means, because it's often ill-defined and it's used in at least a couple of different ways.

title: U.S.-Stock Funds Rise for the Month, Helped by Earnings Reports
summary: The favorite word for CEOs these days is 'inflation'-it is dotting most earnings reports. Despite being buffeted on all sides, the stock market continues to power ahead. And mutual-fund investors are benefiting.

title: The Russian Tank Defeats Captain America in Olympics Wrestling Showdown
summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-It was one of the most hotly anticipated showdowns of the Tokyo Olympics: "Captain America" facing "The Russian Tank" on the wrestling mat.

title: Disney Lawyer Defends Distribution of 'Black Widow' in Scarlett Johansson Fight
summary: Attorney says Disney has complete control over distribution of the movie, will seek to move dispute into arbitration. A lawyer representing Walt Disney Co. in its legal battle against actress Scarlett Johansson defended Disney's distribution of "Black Widow" and said Disney will seek to move the fight from the courts to arbitration.

title: The SAT and ACT Have Issues. Here Are Three Ideas to Replace Them.
summary: The Covid-19 pandemic accelerated a push to scrap the decades-old exams and evaluate applicants in new ways. Author

title: McDonald's Pushes Diners to Use Trays as Food Bags Run Tight
summary: U.S. restaurants' to-go sales remain strong, contributing to packaging shortages; 'Many new crew members have never had to deal with trays'. Burger lovers will have to get used to eating off fast-food trays inside McDonald's again.

title: U.S. Track Team Caps Tokyo Olympics With Dominant Relay Wins
summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-Team USA's two 4×400 relay squads reasserted the might of the U.S. track team Saturday, with the women's team crushing its competition by 3.68 seconds and the men ensuring that Team USA runners won't leave the Tokyo Olympics track without a gold.

title: Say Goodbye to the 1% Investment-Adviser Fee?
summary: Investors who don't want to pay the traditional 1% of assets for financial advice have an increasing number of alternatives. Keith Rudman used to pay hundreds of thousands of dollars annually to an adviser who charged him a fee on managed assets.

title: Cigarette Companies Are Caught Between Death and Taxes
summary: Tobacco giants are counting on sales of noncombustible products to replace carcinogenic smokes. Government duties will influence how quickly that happens.. Cigarette companies are pouring billions of dollars into nicotine products that don't come with the lethal health warnings of traditional smokes. New taxes risk stubbing out the returns on those investments.

title: This Alfa Romeo Is Like Fredo From 'The Godfather.' Its Owner Still Loves It.
summary: Garth Stein's 1974 GTV 2000 can drive him to distraction, but the author of 'The Art of Racing in the Rain' says it still feels like part of family. Garth Stein, 56-year-old Seattle-based novelist, on his 1974 Alfa Romeo GTV 2000, as told to A.J. Baime.

title: Online Therapy Got Popular During Covid. Should You Still See Your Therapist in Person?
summary: Virtual sessions can be convenient, but building rapport online can be tough-especially for children and people with severe symptoms. Should you go back to seeing your therapist in person?

title: Fake Covid Vaccination Cards Are on the Rise
summary: Vaccine mandates have fueled an increase in demand for fraudulent certificates as sellers flourish online. MILAN-As Covid-19 vaccine mandates proliferate in the U.S. and Europe, so are swindlers selling bogus vaccination certificates.

title: Jessica Springsteen and USA Equestrian Team Win Silver After Dramatic Jump-Off
summary: Resume Subscription. TOKYO-Jessica Springsteen came to the Tokyo Olympics as an unusually young competitor in a sport that skews older. Then she and her teammates were thrown into the most pressure-packed showdown that exists in their sport: a jump-off.

title: Berkshire Posts Higher Profit on Railroad, Utilities and Energy Operations
summary: Earnings decline at the company's vast insurance operations. Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. said second-quarter net earnings rose 7%, boosted by improved results for its railroad, utilities and energy companies.

title: Taliban Capture Second Provincial Capital, Tightening Grip on Afghanistan
summary: U.S. Embassy advises all American citizens to leave the country immediately. KABUL-Taliban fighters seized the capital of northern Afghanistan's Jowzjan province Saturday, the second such provincial center to fall to the insurgency in two days, as the U.S. Embassy advised American citizens to leave the country immediately.

title: Uber, Lyft Prices at Records Even as Drivers Return
summary: Data show average fares were at a record in July despite improvement in pandemic-driven shortage of drivers. Drivers are returning to Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc. after the companies spent big on incentives to address a pandemic-driven labor shortage. That shift isn't bringing down fares from record highs, new data show.

title: Tokyo Olympics Closing Ceremony: How to Watch and When It Is
summary: Resume Subscription. Gold, silver and bronze, triumphs and meltdowns-all accompanied by the specter of Covid-19. After what seemed like the blink of an eye, the Tokyo Summer Olympics are almost over. Here's what you need to know about the closing of the Games.

title: He Devised a Solo Soccer Workout to a Heart-Thumping Beat
summary: Hotel CEO uses his background as an amateur DJ to help psych himself up when the only place to practice is alone on his terrace. Rami Zeidan is proof that you don't need teammates-or a field-to finesse your soccer skills and get a heart-thumping workout.

title: Alabama Is Home to One of the U.S.'s Tightest Labor Markets
summary: Resume Subscription. The metropolitan area competing for the tightest labor market in the nation isn't a tech hub on the West Coast, or a boomtown in Texas. It is Birmingham, Ala., a southern city with an unemployment rate that is nearly half the national level and similar to Salt Lake City's.

title: College Hasn't Helped Close the Wealth Gap for Black Americans
summary: Black college graduates in their 30s have lost ground over three decades, the result of student debt and sluggish income growth. Black millennials thought college would help them get ahead. Instead, it is setting them back.

title: Highly Vaccinated States Keep Worst Covid-19 Outcomes in Check
summary: Variant has driven up U.S. cases, but hospitalizations and deaths have risen more slowly in areas with more vaccinations. In the first big test of Covid- 19 vaccines during a Covid-19 surge, places with higher vaccination rates are dodging the worst outcomes so far, while cases and hospitalizations surge in less-vaccinated areas.

title: China's Export Machine Still Hums Despite Covid-19, Extreme Weather
summary: While export and import growth slowed in July, both were still strong. BEIJING-Chinese export and import growth slowed in July as flooding and extreme weather at home disrupted factory and port operations and constrained consumption, while the fast-spreading Delta variant of the coronavirus loomed on the horizon.

title: American Molly Seidel Takes Bronze in Women's Marathon
summary: Resume Subscription. For nearly all of 26.2 sweltering miles in the women's Olympic marathon on Saturday, American Molly Seidel-who had never run a marathon before qualifying for this race in 2020-kept pace with Peres Jepchirchir and Brigid Kosgei, two world-record-holding runners from Kenya, the country that dominates this race.

title: The U.S. Men's Basketball Team Looked Shaky. It Won Gold Anyway.
summary: Resume Subscription. SAITAMA, Japan-The U.S. men's basketball team was still wondering what had just happened after it lost its opening game of the Olympics to France. But coach Gregg Popovich was barely surprised by the result that seemed to shock everyone else. He understood that the rest of the world had spent decades catching up to Team USA-and they were already here.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Can Stimulating Brains Lead to Controlling Them?
summary: Tremendous advances since Pavlov's famous dog experiments have come close to manipulating human reactions-for better or worse. Since the early 20th century, the name of the Russian scientist Ivan Pavlov has been associated with the idea of brainwashing. Pavlov's experiments, in which he trained dogs to salivate in response to a signal such as a bell, showed that the mind could be conditioned to react automatically to stimuli. But he looked forward to a time when science could manipulate the brain directly. In a passage eerily accurate in describing today's neural imaging, he wrote: "If we could look through the skull into the brain of a consciously thinking person...then we should see playing over the cerebral surface a bright spot with fantastic, waving borders, constantly fluctuating in size and form, and surrounded by a darkness, more or less deep, covering the rest of the hemispheres."

title: In the Streaming Wars, Sony Stands on the Sidelines
summary: As competitors are 'beating each other's brains out,' the only major studio that's not a combatant is finding ways to profit. In Hollywood's streaming wars, the only major studio that doesn't have its own service might also be the biggest arms dealer on the battlefield.

title: Amid the Labor Shortage, Robots Step in to Make the French Fries
summary: Fast-food chains are working with a host of startups to bring automation to their kitchens. In a White Castle just southeast of Chicago, the 100-year-old purveyor of fast food has played host for the past year to an unusual, and unusually hardworking, employee: a robotic fry cook.

title: Canada Border Agents End Partial Strike After Labor Deal
summary: Four-year agreement removes potential roadblock for U.S. citizens eligible to visit Canada starting on Monday. OTTAWA-Canada's border agents ended a nearly daylong partial strike Friday after their union and the Canadian government struck a new labor deal, removing a potential roadblock for Americans, who can begin visiting their northern neighbor Monday for the first time in 16 months.

title: CNN's Chris Cuomo Will Take a Week Off
summary: Mr. Cuomo told fellow anchor Don Lemon on a podcast that he's taking a routine vacation. CNN anchor Chris Cuomo said Friday he is taking a weeklong vacation, days after a new report detailed his role as an adviser to his brother, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo, who faces allegations of sexual harassment and pressure to resign.

title: SEC Pauses Enforcement of Some Whistleblower Program Rules
summary: The move comes after SEC chairman said he was directing staff to prepare potential revisions to two amendments for the agency's consideration. The Securities and Exchange Commission said it would look into revising two amendments to its whistleblower award program rules adopted last September, adding that in the interim it would largely pause enforcement of parts of the two amendments.

title: Covid-19 Vaccine Mandates on the Rise for Nursing Home Workers
summary: Vaccination rates for staff trail resident rates as highly contagious Delta variant spreads. More states and employers are requiring nursing home staff to be vaccinated as the latest Delta-driven Covid-19 surge leads to more cases in some facilities.

title: Cheddar Brownies
summary: Chunks of cheddar add a wonderful complementary element to fudgy brownies. To explore and search through all our recipes, check out the new WSJ Recipes page.
